review_title: Small hospital that has a lot to offer
pros: Decent wages. Laboratory keeps up with current technology, Lab procedures are well written and easy to follow
cons: HR does not promote or try to entice employees for the lab like they do for nursing. Small town atmosphere lends itself to gossip and cliques

pros: Easy Hours, Helpful Staff, Relaxed Learning Environment and overall an easy job.
cons: Some positions that were connected to Environmental Service at the time were bad for employee job longevity. But since I left it has been separated into it's own job category.

job_title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist in Morris, IL
pros: Much less work. Less than 100 beds.
cons:
Everyone has to learn everything as quickly as possible. Very clickish.
Have trouble hiring techs.

review_title: Be wary of five star reviews
pros: They make it seem like you get vacation time. Some co-workers are welcoming while others are not.
cons: DO NOT WORK HERE.  It is nearly impossible to take time off. The days you do get off are national holidays but you do not get holiday pay like other companies instead they take it out of your vacation. Management is concerned with self image and care very little for employees. Just had a meeting where management wanted volunteers to present progress to the board and make it seem like we were making progress when we haven’t. We have to constantly suck up to middle management just to keep the peace. The insurance is garbage. I just paid $290 for a generic prescription. We work  on Saturdays and are forced to ask patients to pay for a procedure before the actual procedure to get them to commit to the hospital for a measly $25 dollar gift card. Did I mention we get paid less than employees at fast food chains.

job_title: Senior Medical Secretary in Joliet, IL
pros: Small community hospital with a family like setting.
cons: Privately owned and not competitive with other area hospitals

review_title: mostly a good place to work

cons: Toxic work environment at times with management. Having to look out for yourself constantly.

review_title: Hospital only cares about money Patients mean nothing.

review_title: No Words To Describe How Horrifying!
pros:
This is a "NO STAR" review.  I have become a lesser person for walking through the door.  Many post op infections.  No wonder...food found on the Anesthesia med machines.  Administration is horrible.  Benefits not that great.  Small town, small hospital full of local gossip and full of itself as an entity.  Looking for new employment after my first 90 days.  Be prepared for a hazing probationary period.  Managers are trained, professional liars.  All smiles and tell you what you want to hear, to get you on board, only to find out after you have been hired, that
"I incorrectly informed you of that during your interview."  Beware of the artificial smiles (and body parts!) to make it seem like a welcoming environment.  It is anything but that.  There are a select few that are genuine.  Beware of everyone that crosses your path!  And I can not describe how unprofessional the surgical staff can be, when a patient is "sedated". Making rude comments about their weight and other things too bad to mention.
This is an absolutely terrible place to work, unless you were born and bred there, and your family is a farmer and most likely on the Board.  Maybe the Board Members do not even know what is really going on in that hospital.
cons: Everything. Like I said, I am a lesser person for even considering working there.

pros: Good benefits and nice people.
cons: must use PTO for holiday pay. Low pay.

pros: Nothing this place is horrible
cons: Everything, nobody cares about the patients or the staff

job_title: Patient Services Representative in Morris, IL
pros: Excellent benefits, ways to earn a bonus once a year, lots of ways to volunteer in the hospital and community.
cons: Pulled office to office. Bullying is never handled correctly. Very UNDERSTAFFED. scheduler is on a power trip. You can work harder than you ever have but no one cares. Meeting after meeting.

review_title: Morris Hospital is a good employer.
pros: Morris Hospital is a good community hospital with longterm employees. They value their employees.
cons: I cannot say a negative thing about Morris Hospital. I believe they are a quality employer and are going through some tough times.

pros: Small town hospital, good pay
cons: Everyone knows your business, administration and management do not support or stick up for staff, weekends are basically "sit and wait" for testing.

pros: SOME good co-workers, not many weekends or holidays
cons: Picking and tormented employees that were not in the “good ol boy” club. Had some great employees who went above and beyond for patients but was fired because “ to much time spent with patients”
